li.div: A 23-year-old African man who underwent total thyroidectomy 3 years ago presents with an unsightly swelling over the scar of the surgery. He complains of needle-like pains and itching over the swelling.
A 35-year-old woman underwent a total thyroidectomy. On the fourth post-operative day she complains of tingling and numbness in the face and fingers.
A 65-year-old man presents to his GP with a history of lethargy and weight gain. He underwent total thyroidectomy 6 months ago for thyroid carcinoma.
A 35-year-old man who underwent lobectomy of the thyroid gland is found to have a weak hoarse voice a few days after surgery.

simpleChoice.div: Injury to external branch of superior laryngeal nerve
Injury to the recurrent laryngeal nerve

modalFeedback.p: Option F (Injury to the recurrent laryngeal nerve) is Correct. Bruising of the recurrent laryngeal nerve results in temporary paralysis of a vocal cord in 5% of cases, but normal recovery is within 3 months with permanent paralysis in <1%. Injury to the external branch of the superior laryngeal nerve results in more subtle changes to the voice more likely to be noticed by patients who use their voice professionally.
